isis.stitle: TSI 07-16-05R - Intermittent HVAC Temperature Actuator Motor Operation

subjectgroup.subject: Intermittent HVAC Temperature Actuator Motor Operation

geninfo.para: HPV vehicles built before 6/20/2007 that are setting with fault code 613-14-1-4 or that are having issues with the temperature door actuator may need the control circuit rewired. The HVAC control head controls three 7-volt, motor-driven doors (two on vehicles without A/C). These doors control the mode (defrost, panel, and floor), temperature blend, and inlet air (with A/C only). The control head monitors door position by counting pulses coming back from the actuators (for more detail on how the control circuit functions, refer to manual S08293, pages 73 and 74). These are cases that the control head is receiving noise coming from other power sources behind the instrument panel. Installing a twisted pair circuit from the control head to the actuator motor will cancel out the circuit noise before it reaches the control head.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.

note.para: Before rewiring be sure to troubleshoot the control head and the door actuator.

step1.para: Remove the HVAC control head from the dash and disconnect the electrical connector.
Remove the electrical connector from the Temperature Actuator motor (Figure 1).
Route two new different colored 18 gauge wires from the control head to the temperature actuator motor connector.
Remove wire number A74D from cavity B11 of the control head connector and tape it to the wiring harness (Figure 2).
Install terminal part number 3522073C1 on one of the wires and insert in cavity B11.
Remove wire number A74E from cavity B12 of the control head connector and tape it to the wiring harness.
Install terminal part number 3522073C1 on one of the wires and insert in cavity B12.
Remove wire A74D from cavity A of the temperature actuator motor connector and tape it back to the harness.

Trace the wire that was placed into cavity B11 and install terminal part number 2033819C1 and seal part number 1652325C1 on the opposite end of the wire and insert in cavity A of the temperature actuator motor connector.
Remove wire A74E from cavity B of the temperature actuator motor connector and tape it back to the harness.

Trace the wire that was placed into cavity B12 and install terminal part number 2033819C1 and seal part number 1652325C1 on the opposite end of the wire and insert in cavity B of the temperature actuator.
Connect the connector into the back of the control head and install the control head.
Test the operation of the temperature door.
